Question 2.Question: The necessary attributes of a state are
Question 2.Explanation: To be called a state, it must have a well-defined set of boundaries to which it can lay claims to. It must also have a sizeable number of people in it as its citizens, must be free from external control in governing itself and must have machinery set up by itself through which the will of the state will be executed.

Question 7.Explanation: A bicameral legislature is one with two houses. The establishment of the two chambers prevents one of the legislative chambers from manipulating bills to satisfy its selfish ends through the checks of the other chambers.

Question 9.Explanation: A unitary form of government favours a relatively small country with a homogenous population for effectiveness and efficiency. An example of a country using this system is Ghana.

Question 11.Explanation: Liberalism is a political ideology which encourages an egalitarian society through the willingness to respect and accept the behaviour and opinions of others in the society, in the decision making process for the development of that society. Question 42.Explanation: Professor Bolaji Akinyemi was appointed Minister of External Affairs by military leader Ibrahim Babangida in 1985.
